article_title: Stop Physician Burnout: New Book Gives First Step-By-Step Formula to Prevent Burnout in All
article_text:
SEATTLE, Dec. 9, 2014 /PRNewswire/ -- With burnout levels at an all-time high, even the best doctors are unknowingly making mistakes and upsetting patients. Some are so frustrated they are giving up on their life's work and leaving practice. This is all due to the massive hole in the medical education process. And it all can end now.

Dike Drummond MD, CEO of TheHappyMD.com, announces the release of his groundbreaking new book, "Stop Physician Burnout – What to Do When Working Harder Isn't Working." This is the first field manual for any physician in any specialty to build a more Ideal Practice and balanced life.

Using over 1,257 hours of one-on-one coaching experience working with hundreds of burned out doctors, Dr. Drummond wrote "Stop Physician Burnout" to show physicians how to recognize burnout when it strikes and 21 tools proven to actually prevent it.

The first half of "Stop Physician Burnout" teaches burnout's causes, complications, pathophysiology and the different ways it presents in men and women. The second half of the book teaches 21 different techniques to decrease the unique stresses experienced by today's practicing physician. Each technique can be implemented immediately and has been field-tested to produce immediate benefits to the user. Dr. Drummond also includes chapters on a breakthrough method to find your ideal job and how to create an ideal retirement. He illustrates the potency of his real-world advice with seven case studies taken from his own pool of physician coaching clients.

With physician burnout at epidemic levels and a tidal wave of newly insured patients on the way, healthcare organizations are stretched to the breaking point. Despite the need for tools to support the health of the providers, there remains an enormous gap in the education of modern physicians… until now.

"Stop Physician Burnout" is the first field-tested guide to lowering stress levels and creating a more Ideal Practice for the modern physician. It deserves a place on the desk of every practicing physician and in the curriculum of every medical school and residency program in the nation.

Purchase your copy from TheHappyMD.com website at http://www.thehappymd.com/book.

International orders can be completed through Amazon.com by searching "Stop Physician Burnout" or with the direct link here: http://www.amazon.com/Stop-Physician-Burnout-Working-Harder/dp/1937660346/



For Bulk Orders at a significant discount or speaking or interview requests, contact Dr. Drummond directly using this link: http://www.thehappymd.com/contact

Research shows an average of one in three physicians suffer from burnout on any given office day and, in a 2012 study, 60% of doctors said they would quit if they "had the means." Healthcare organizations are struggling to keep doctors healthy and patients happy. Adding to these pressures, the implementation of the Affordable Care Act is projected to produce a physician shortage of 91,500 by 2020.

"Physicians are often the canary in the coal mine of medicine and that has to change. The most successful healthcare organizations in the years ahead will be those who take excellent care of their providers and staff. 'Stop Physician Burnout' is an authentic breakthrough as the first burnout prevention self-help manual for the modern physician," Drummond says.

Each of the tools in "Stop Physician Burnout" has been field tested with hundreds of practicing physicians. Each technique stands on its own and will lower doctor's stress at work and/or increase their ability to recharge while off the job. For no additional charge, Dr. Drummond also provides in-depth assistance with implementation of these techniques through free membership in his website for book purchasers.

TheHappyMD.com (www.thehappymd.com) is the premier source of tools and training to reduce doctors' stress levels, prevent burnout and optimize the physician experience. CEO Dike Drummond MD has consulted with or been a featured speaker for Kaiser Permanente Northwest, MD Anderson Cancer Center, McKesson US Oncology Network, The Group Practice Improvement Network, the AAFP, the ACPE, the Minnesota Medical Association and many more.

His writings on Burnout Prevention, Leadership and Work Life Balance have been published extensively online at HuffingtonPost.com, KevinMD.com as well as publications such as Medical Economics, Physician's Practice and AMA News.
